choices.text: It is a type of traction diverticulum.
It arises from the posterior hypopharynx.
The diagnostic test is Ba. Swallow.
Usual surgical treatment is diverticulectomy with cricopharyngeal myotomy.

questions.text: False statement regarding Zanker’s diverticulum is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Zanker’s diverticulum is a type of pulsion acquired diverticulum.

choices.text: Urgent initial tracheostomy to prevent aspiration then definitive curative thoracotomy.
Initial Total Parenteral nutrition then curative thoracotomy.
Initial feeding gastrostomy and treatment of pneumonia then definitive thoracotomy.

questions.text: A Patient of Tracheo-esophageal fistula with good birth weight and no pneumonia is best treated by?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

(WATERSTON CRITERIA: If weight is > 5.5 Lb and pneumonia is absent then single stage surgery can be done. If Severe pneumonia or weight is < 4.5 Lb it is treated first by gastrostomy and later on by definitive surgery. If sepsis or pulmonary infection is suspected, broad-spectrum antibiotics should be administered. Before surgical correction, the infant must be evaluated thoroughly for other congenital anomalies. Gastrostomy for gastric decompression is reserved for use in patients with significant pneumonia or atelectasis, to prevent reflux of gastric contents through the fistula and into the trachea. Healthy infants without pulmonary complications or other major anomalies usually can undergo primary repair in the first few day

choices.text: Antibiotics/ IV Fluids and Nil orally (Conservative Treatment).
Only in case of no response by conservative treatment and deterioration, Suregry should be done.
Antibiotics (Broad spectrum aerobic and anaerobic)/ IV Fluids with liquid diet for 4 weeks.

questions.text: While attempting the removal of foreign body from lower esophagus by rigid endoscope, the patient complains of severe pain in abdomen and central chest. After the procedure X-ray showed pneumoperitoneum and pneumomediastinum. Best treatment for this patient is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

(pneumoperitoneum and pneumomediastinum suggests lower/ abdominal esophageal perforation)
Indications for operative repair in esophageal injury are: Large septic load/ Septic shock/ Pleural breach/ Boerhaave syndrome/ Perforation of abdominal esophagus. (Bailley page: 998)

questions.text: Best palliative treatment for malignant tracheo-esophageal fistula is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Metallic stents are probably the best treatment, though some advocate surgical bypass or esophageal exclusion. (Bailley page: 1006)
In some MCQ books Radiotherapy is given as answer which is wrong, actually RT is contraindicated when fistula is present

choices.text: It is common with down’s syndrome.
Commonest type is pure esophageal atrasia.
Primary measure includes decreasing risk of aspiration.

questions.text: Which of the following is not true about tracheo-esophageal fistula?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Commonest type is proximal atresia with distal fistula – 85%

questions.text: A 50 year old male after heavy meal went for walk. He developed severe chest pain associated with vomiting. He was brought to Emergency room and CT scan revealed pneumomediastinum. Most probable diagnosis in this patient is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Boerhaave syndrome is a spontaneous transmural perforation of the esophagus resulting from a sudden rise in intraluminal pressure caused by an uncoordinated act of forceful vomiting against a closed cricopharyngeal sphincter. 
Pneumomediastinum will not be present in options A and D. B will present with dyspnea rather than pain.

questions.text: Sideropenic dysphagea is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

choices.text: Mainly caused by vomiting or retching.
It is a submucosa deep tear.
Epigastric pain is the main presenting symptom.

questions.text: False statement about Mellory Weiss syndrome is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Mallory-Weiss syndrome is characterized by upper gastrointestinal bleeding (not pain) due to a mucosal tear at the esophago-gastric junction.

questions.text: Most common site of esophageal carcinoma is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: In which type of gastritis incidence of cancer is maximum?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Bailley page: 1036

choices.text: Anterior and posterior vagus nerves are preserved but its branched are devided.
The recurrence rate is less than truncal vagotomy.
Higher incidence of cancer observed after truncal vagotomy is not seen after highly selective vagotomy.

questions.text: False statement about highly selective vagotomy is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Recurrence rate after truncal vegotomy is 2-7%, but after highly selective it is 2-10%. 
Bailley page: 1041-42

questions.text: False statement about congenital hypertrophic pyloric stenosis is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Ramstedt Pyloromyotomy rather than pyeloroplasty is the treatment

choices.text: Duodenal is more common than gastric ulceration.
H2-blockers will heal 85-95% of duodenal ulcers in 8 weeks
Triple therapy can eradicate H. pylori in 80% of patients in one week
H. pylori is a gram-positive bacillus

questions.text: Regarding peptic ulceration false statement is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

H pylori is a gram negative bacilli.

questions.text: A 45 year old male executive is having frank hematemesis. There is no significant past history except for occasional history of upper abdomen dyspeptic pain. He admits to have one drink a week. He has already bled 5 units of blood. What do you expect to find in upper GI endoscopy?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Massive upper GI bleed is usually due to bleed proximal to ligament of treitz. Most likely cause is posterior duodenal ulcer. Varices is unlikely without evidence of cirrhosis and portal HT

choices.text: Gastric cancer in mucosa or submucosa with or without nodes.
Gastric cancer upto muscle but not involving nodes

questions.text: Which of the following type best defines early gastric cancer?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Early gastric cancer is in defined as cancer limited to mucosa and submucosa with or without node involvement (T1 any N)
Bailley page: 1051

questions.text: Best prognosis in stomach cancer is seen in?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Only about 10% of all GIST are malignant with 50% 5 year survival rate

choices.text: Total gastrectomy with Roux en Y esophagojejunostomy

questions.text: Best treatment for a 5 cm cancer situated at the fundus of stomach with 2 positive nodes is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Main treatment for gastric cancer is surgery. Potential curable lesions are treated with subtotal or total gastrectomy on tumour location. Wide margin (>6 cm.) is necessary because of extensive submucosal tumour spread.Distal tumour is treated by subtotal wile proximal tumour by Total gastrectomy with Roux en Y esophagojejunostomy. (NMS page 208)

choices.text: Origin is from cells of Kultichisky
Imatinab is a new effective drug for adjuvant therapy.

questions.text: Which is false for GIST (Gastro intestinal stromal tumor) of stomach?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

GIST (3% of all gastric malignancies), were previously classified as leiomyomas or leiomyosarcomas. Histologically, they appear to arise from the muscularis propria & not mucosa; and originate from the cells of Cajal. C Kit protein is detected by immunohistochemistry. Imatinib mesylate is a competitive inhibitor of certain tyrosine kinases, with 54% of patients exhibiting at least a partial response

questions.text: Most common type of gastric volvulus is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Organo-axial: The stomach rotates around an axis that connects the gastroesophageal junction and the pylorus. This is the most common type in both children and adults. It is usually associated with diaphragmatic defects. Strangulation and necrosis occurs commonly with this type and has been reported in 5-28% of cases.

choices.text: Plain X ray shows double bubble sign.
Commonest presenting symptom is bilious vomiting few hours after birth.

questions.text: False statement regarding duodenal atresia is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Polyhydramnios (in 50%) is seen not oligohydroamnios.

choices.text: Omental patch with non absorbable sutures.

questions.text: A perforated duodenal ulcer is closed by?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Graham’s operation. Bailley page: 1046

choices.text: Resection and anastomosis (Including ulcer and diverticulum both).
Diverticulectomy with wedge resection of ulcer.
Angioembolization of bleeding vessel of the ulcer.

questions.text: A child presented with small bowel bleed due to bleeding ulcer adjacent to Meckle’s diverticulum. Best treatment for him should be?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

A bleeding diverticulum with an indurated area in the adjacent ileum (Suggesting ectopic tissue) requires resection of this section of the bowel and the diverticulum. A bleeding diverticulum without ileal induration requires only resection of the diverticulum (Diverticulectomy).
Bailley page: 1160

questions.text: Multiple air fluid level is not seen in?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

In duodenal atresia double bubble sign is seen. Multiple air fluid level seen in SBO.

choices.text: It is characterized by a dilated proximal segment and a spastic distal segment joined together by a funnel shaped transition zone.
There is absence of intramural and submucosal ganglion.
There is absence of nerve in affected segment.
Aganglionic segment show increase in enzyme Acetylcholinestrase activity.

questions.text: Which of the following is false regarding Hirschsprung’s disease?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Histology demonstrates aganglionosis and hypertrophied nerve fibres (Not absent nerves) in the nerve plexus. Bailley page: 1154

questions.text: Least common position of appendix is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Retroileal is seen in only .2% MOst common position is retrocaecal 65% followed by Pelvic (20%), preileal and post ileal

choices.text: Appendicectomy through exploratory laparotomy suspecting appendicular perforation.

questions.text: A 17 yr old boy was treated by a GP for pain right iliac fossa by antibiotic and analgesic. His symptoms did not improve after 3 days and due to recurrent vomiting and persistence of pain he attended ER. On examination his PR was 102/ min, temp was 100.4 F and there was a palpable tender lump in RIF. USG revealed a mass of 3 × 4 cm in size and no fluid in pouch of Duglus. No obvious evidence of abscess was there. Ideal treatment for this patient is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Diagnosis is Appendicular lump so patient should be managed now on Oschener scherren regimen.

questions.text: A 42 yr old lady with past history of hysterectomy 4 years back presents to the emergency department with abdominal pain and vomiting. On examination bowel sounds were increased and X ray showed multiple air fluid level. What is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Previus history in a case of small bowel obstruction is almost always due to post op adhesions.

questions.text: Most premalignant condition for colonic cancer is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

choices.text: Regular follow up and no further treatment as serosa is intact and Duke stage is C1

questions.text: In a patient with H/O of bleeding PR, colonoscopy showed a 2 cm mass in left colon. Postoperative histopathological finding was tumour infiltrating in muscle with intact serosa and 2 positive lymph nodes (Dukes C 1). Now best further treatment for this patient will be?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Chemotherapy (5 FU and leucovorin and recently oxaliplatin) is always given in node positive diseas.

choices.text: Colostomy and second stage fistula surgery (as it is > 2 cm from anal verge)

questions.text: Ideal treatment for a low type of fistula in ano 2.5 cms from anal verge is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

A single low type fistula is treated with fistolotomy. Seton wiring is done for high type or unfit patient. Colostomy is reserved for very complicated multiple opening or very high type of fistula.

questions.text: A 75 yrs old lady presented to ER with H/O chronic constipation, pain abdomen and obstipation for 1 day. Abdomen was grossly distended and tympanetic on percussion. X ray abdomen showed “OMEGA sign”. Next step in management should be?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Here the diagnosis is sigmoid volvulus. Initial treatment for sigmoid volvulus is sigmoidoscopy to derotate the volvulus.

questions.text: Nigro’s regimen of chemo-radiation is used for?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Chemo-Radiation therapy for Squamous cell cancer of anal canal is called Nigro’s regimen

choices.text: Presents as opening in natal cleft.
Hair tufts are seen through the opening with hair follicles and hair roots in histopathology.
Surgical excision is the treatment of choice.

questions.text: False statement about pilonidal sinus is?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Hair of pilonidal sinus are dead hair

questions.text: Transverse skin crease incision for appendicectomy is called?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

choices.text: Left hemicolectomy and end to end anastomosis
Primary closure of perforation in 2 layers.

questions.text: Best treatment for a case of colonic diverticulosis presenting as perforation is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

questions.text: Commonest type of intussusception is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.text: Best investigation for Meckle’s with hemorrhage is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A)

choices.text: Roof is formed by conjoint tendon
Deep inguinal ring is formed by transverse abdominus muscle.
Superficial inguinal ring is formed by ext. obliq. Muscle/ apponeurosis.
Int. obliq muscle forms anterior and post. wall

questions.text: All are true regarding inguinal canal except
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Deep inguinal ring is formed by fascia transversalis and not by transverse abdominus muscle.

choices.text: Lies lateral to the femoral vein
Has the inguinal ligament as its poeterior border
Has the lacunar ligament as its lateral border
Has the pectineal ligament as its posterior border

questions.text: The femoral canal
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

The femoral canal is medial to the femoral vein, has the inguinal ligament as its anterior border, has the lacunar ligament as its medial border and has the pectineal ligament as its posterior border

choices.text: It is the commonest type of congenital diaphragmatic hernia.
More common on the left side.
More common on the anterior part (retrosternal).

questions.text: False statement regarding Bochdalek hernia is?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D)
